why_choose_section.title: Why Choose Synchrony for Respiratory Devices
why_choose_section.description: Four decades of minimally invasive device expertise provides specialized bronchoscopic infrastructure, validated pulmonary disease models, and proven regulatory success that general preclinical facilities cannot match.

cards.title: Bronchoscopic Intervention Capabilities
cards.description: Advanced bronchoscopy suites equipped with flexible and rigid scopes, fluoroscopic guidance systems, and real-time pulmonary function monitoring enable comprehensive assessment of endobronchial device deployment, positioning accuracy, and airway navigation across varying anatomical challenges.

cards.title: Pulmonary Disease Model Expertise
cards.description: Validated COPD-induced emphysema models replicate airway remodeling, hyperinflation characteristics, and impaired gas exchange that bronchoscopic interventions address. Our team understands pulmonary mechanics, ventilation-perfusion relationships, and device performance in diseased lung environments that COPD technology development requires.

cards.title: Respiratory Device Regulatory Success
cards.description: Successful FDA submissions across bronchoscopic volume reduction platforms and pulmonary sealant technologies demonstrate our ability to generate data that addresses reviewer expectations for minimally invasive respiratory interventions requiring comprehensive safety and effectiveness validation per ISO 10993 respiratory device guidance.

services.title: Bronchoscopic Volume Reduction Validation
services.description: COPD interventions reducing lung volume face unique challenges proving therapeutic benefit while ensuring bronchoscopic deployment safety in diseased airways. We evaluate endobronchial valve performance using validated emphysema models that replicate hyperinflation and collateral ventilation characteristics determining device effectiveness. Our protocols assess valve deployment accuracy under fluoroscopic guidance, sealing integrity preventing air passage to isolated lobes, and pulmonary function changes through spirometry and plethysmography measurements. From one-way valve mechanisms to coil-based volume reduction platforms, our testing addresses both 510(k) pathways demonstrating substantial equivalence and PMA requirements for breakthrough COPD technologies requiring comprehensive effectiveness demonstration supporting clinical trial initiation.

services.title: Pulmonary Sealant Assessment
services.description: Lung sealants preventing prolonged air leaks following pulmonary resection must demonstrate adhesion strength sufficient to withstand respiratory pressures while supporting pleural healing without inflammatory complications. We evaluate sealant performance using standardized air leak quantification protocols that measure seal integrity under physiological ventilation pressures while tissue response studies assess healing quality at pleural surfaces. Burst pressure testing validates acute sealing effectiveness while chronic implantation studies track sealant degradation, inflammatory response, and tissue integration throughout healing phases. Our GLP-compliant protocols support regulatory submissions across synthetic adhesives, fibrin-based sealants, and hydrogel platforms requiring ISO 10993 biocompatibility demonstration alongside mechanical performance validation per ASTM surgical sealant standards for thoracic applications.
